articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: The Israeli military said Hezbollah had fired dozens of rockets and several drones into northern Israel on Saturday killing one person, with one drone directed at Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's holiday home, according to his spokesman.
articles.title: Hezbollah fires rockets into northern Israel as Israeli strikes pound Gaza

articles.author: Portia Crowe, Ngouda Dione
articles.description: "Ten minutes later, they called me: 'there's no more house, no more son'."
articles.title: 'Everything is lost': Senegal repatriates citizens escaping Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces are fighting street-to-street battles with Ukrainian troops in the outskirts of the eastern Ukrainian town of Selydove as Moscow's forces push to gain control over the whole of the Donbas region, according to pro-Russian bloggers.
articles.title: Russian forces storming town in eastern Ukraine, bloggers say

articles.author: Dave Sherwood
articles.description: Cuba's efforts to restore power to the island were derailed for a third time late on Saturday, Cuban authorities said shortly before midnight, leaving millions in the dark and raising fresh questions over the viability of the government's bid to reestablish electrical service.
articles.title: Cuba suffers third major setback in restoring power to island, millions still in dark

articles.author: Ananda Teresia, Stefanno Sulaiman
articles.description: Indonesia's Prabowo Subianto on Sunday will take over as president of the world's third-largest democracy after sweeping the country's election with policies like free meals for school children and with the outgoing leader's son as his running mate.
articles.title: Former special forces commander Prabowo to take up Indonesian presidency

articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Steve Holland
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris will kick off her 60th birthday on Sunday with two church visits in Georgia, where she plans to rally early voters, while her Republican rival, Donald Trump, spends time at a McDonald's fast food place in Pennsylvania.
articles.title: Harris to mark 60th birthday with Atlanta church visits as Trump hits McDonald's

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Floods in Bangladesh have destroyed an estimated 1.1 million metric tons of rice, according to data from the agriculture ministry, prompting the country to ramp up imports of the staple grain amid soaring food prices.
articles.title: Floods destroy 1.1 mln tons of rice in Bangladesh

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli planes dropped leaflets over southern Gaza on Saturday showing a picture of the dead Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar with the message that "Hamas will no longer rule Gaza", echoing language used by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.
articles.title: Israel drops leaflets over Gaza showing Sinwar's body and message to Hamas

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: Billionaire Elon Musk promised on Saturday to give away $1 million each day until November's election to someone who signs his online petition supporting the U.S. Constitution.
articles.title: Elon Musk promises to award $1 mln each day to a signer of his petition

articles.author: Steve Holland, Andrea Shalal, Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump hit the campaign trail on Saturday, pressing their case with voters from Georgia to Pennsylvania who are already starting to cast ballots in the U.S. presidential election.
articles.title: Harris, Trump court early voters; Usher, Lizzo on the campaign trail
